inlineContent.text: is a Swift SDK that lets you create fully customizable keyboards in a few lines of code, using SwiftUI. It extends the native Apple APIs and provides you with a lot more functionality.
extends KeyboardKit with pro features, such as fully localized keyboards and services, autocomplete, an emoji keyboard, AI supporting capabilities, themes, dictation, etc.
KeyboardKit Pro can be installed with the Swift Package Manager:
Unlike KeyboardKit, KeyboardKit Pro is a binary target and must ONLY be added to the app target. If you add it to any other target, it may crash at runtime.
See the
article for information on how to get started with KeyboardKit.
KeyboardKit supports
keyboard-specific
s:
unlocks localized layouts, callouts & behaviors for all supported locales, as described in the
article.
KeyboardKit Pro unlocks Pro features in many parts of the librayr:
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks more essential tools, system keyboard previews, etc.
- KeyboardKit Pro registers emoji actions to keep the
category in sync.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks tools that are required for AI-based features.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks a local and a remote autocomplete.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks callout actions for every supported locale.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks pre-defined dictation services and a speech recognizer.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks a powerful emoji keyboard.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks ways to detect and react to external keyboards.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks components for toogling feedback on & off.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks input sets and layouts for every supported locale.
- KeyboardKit Pro supports all 63 locales.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks system keyboard previews that can be used in the app.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks ways for
to read the full document.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks views that let you type within the keyboard extension.
- KeyboardKit Pro unlocks a theme engine with many pre-defined themes.
is a commercial add-on that unlocks pro features, like localized keyboards, layouts & services for all supported locales, on-device and remote autocomplete & autocorrect, dictation, themes, etc.
The
on the App Store lets you try many pro features directly on your iPhone & iPad, without having to write any code.
You can purchase a KeyboardKit Pro license from the
KeyboardKit Pro is closed source.

abstract.text: KeyboardKit helps you create custom keyboard extensions with Swift and SwiftUI.
This protocol can be implemented by types that can return a
list of frequently used emojis.
This article describes the KeyboardKit callout engine.
This namespace is used to contain integration-related types.
This namespace contains dictation-related types, as well
as disabled service implementations.
This style can be used to modify the visual style of the
component and its nested views.

a namespace for license-related types.
This article describes the KeyboardKit keyboard image engine.
This link can be used to navigate to System Settings.

An input set defines the input keys on a keyboard.

used as a license-based feature.

This context can be used to handle regular in-app dictation
and keyboard-based dictation.

autocomplete suggestions as the user types.
This view can be used to type in a keyboard extension.

This view can be used to type in a keyboard extension.
This namespace contains callout-related types.
This enum defines KeyboardKit-supported locales and is a
namespace for related types.

remote, REST-based API.

This view mimics a native emoji keyboard.

able to check the enabled state of a keyboard extension.
This class can perform local, on-device autocomplete.
This service can be used to perform dictation in targets

KeyboardKit helps you create custom keyboard extensions with Swift and SwiftUI.
This article describes the KeyboardKit external keyboard engine.
This protocol can be implemented by classes that can define
styles for different parts of a keyboard.

with KeyboardKit

then applies theme-based overrides.

types.
